text:
Running the example splits the univariate series into six samples where each sample has
three input time steps and one output time step.
[10 20 30] 40
[20 30 40] 50
[30 40 50] 60
[40 50 60] 70
[50 60 70] 80
[60 70 80] 90
Listing 7.5: Example output from transforming a univariate time series into a supervised learning
problem.
Now that we know how to prepare a univariate series for modeling, letâ€™s look at developing
an MLP model that can learn the mapping of inputs to outputs.
